meanings.definition: Relating to or concerned with the theory of relativity.
meanings.sent1: The scientist explained the relativistic effects of time dilation in space travel.
meanings.sent2: The concept of relativistic mass highlights the importance of considering different frames of reference.
meanings.sent3: The relativistic rabbit thought time moved slower when it was late for a very important date.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of the universe became relativistic, like a kaleidoscope of shifting perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The relativistic nature of reality made her question the certainty of everything she knew.

meanings.definition: Showing or suggesting that there are no absolute standards of comparison.
meanings.sent1: In a relativistic world, beauty is truly in the eye of the beholder.
meanings.sent2: The relativistic nature of morality means different cultures may have conflicting values.
meanings.sent3: The relativistic cat believed that the best seat in the house was wherever it decided to sit.
meanings.sent4: Her relativistic view on success allowed her to appreciate progress over perfection.
meanings.sent5: The relativistic approach to truth challenged her to see beyond black and white.
